title: The Tortoise and the Hare
summary: A speedy hare challenges a steady tortoise and learns that bragging can trip you up.
imageAlt: Close-up of a tortoise on a dirt path.
author: Jacob Sutanto
body: The forest animals gathered for a race. The hare bounced with energy and bragged that he would win by a mile.
The tortoise stretched his neck and nodded. "I may be slow," he said, "but I never give up."
When the race began, the hare zipped ahead. Soon he grew bored. He took a nap under a shady tree.
The tortoise moved at a steady pace. Step by careful step, he passed the sleeping hare and reached the finish line first.
The hare woke up too late. "How did I lose?" he cried. The tortoise smiled. "Fast feet are nice, but steady steps win the race."

questions.prompt: Why did the hare lose the race?
options: He stopped to take a nap.
questions.explanation: He napped and the tortoise passed him.

questions.prompt: What is the message of the fable?
options: Always run as fast as you can.
Slow and steady wins the race.
It is better to skip races.
questions.explanation: The story teaches that steady effort beats overconfidence.

questions.prompt: Which words show that the hare was a bragger?
options: He bragged he would win by a mile.
questions.explanation: The hare bragged about winning easily.

prompts: Think of a time you kept going even when something was hard. What happened?
How would the story change if the hare encouraged the tortoise instead?
